cleaned_text: According to the reports published by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, over 73% of older people belonging to the age group 60-69 years are affected by a number of health disorders. Homeopathic Treatment for Old Age Problems As Old age, your body and immune system undergo several changes due to various reasons - [hormonal imbalance](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/hormonal-imbalance), change in eating habits, lifestyle changes, and underlying medical conditions. Among several old-age health conditions, the commonly observed ones are - - Prostate gland problems- The prostate gland is the reproductive organ in the male body. This small walnut-sized organ is present at the base of the bladder. Through the urethra, urine flows from the bladder. When the prostate gland becomes enlarged, it obstructs urinal flow through the urethra. As the urethra constricts, the bladder starts to contract forcefully so you get an urge to urinate frequently. Symptoms of an [enlarged prostate](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/enlarged-prostate)may include- slow or weak urinary stream, [frequent urination](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/frequent-urination), an urgency to urinate especially at night. - Joint problem- Musculoskeletal or degenerative disorders can lead to wear-and-tear of bone cartilages. Such a condition over time can cause [joint inflammation](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/joint-inflammation)or other orthopedic disorders like [arthritis](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/arthritis), gout, [osteoporosis](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/osteoporosis-profile), etc. [Urinary incontinence](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/urinary-incontinence)- Refers to uncontrollable leakage of urine. This condition is more common in women than in men. Overactive or weak bladder muscles, nerve damage, [pregnancy](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/pregnancy), [menopause](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/menopause-wellness-panel/health-feed)are some of the factors responsible for urinary incontinence in females. [Sciatica](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/sciatica)- This condition occurs when the sciatic nerves are strained by bone spurs on the vertebrae or a herniated disk in the spine. It is characterized by constant sharp [pain](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/pain)in the lower back along the sciatic nerve. You may feel the pain on one side of your leg or [hip](https://www.lybrate.com/doctors-for-hip).
